choices.B: Restore a file server base image from backup
choices.A: Build file server instances with the OEM DVD
choices.C: Use the file server template to build the file server instances
choices.D: Build the server instances using a boot from a SAN image

questions.question_text: The IT department receives a client request to build multiple file server instances. Which of the following is the MOST efficient way for a cloud systems administrator to fulfill this request?

discussion.content: why D is more efficient than C ?
I’d go with D - incorrect gateway

this is vague but i have a feeling is something like 

both VMs have the same subnet but can't reach another network outside its address. a ping will work across the same network but not ousite. you will need a valid route/gateway.

Going with D.

Answer should be D - Incorrect Gateway. If VM was configured with wrong gateway, VMs from other subnets could absolutely not ping to mentioned VM.
Answer should not be A. 
For example: Let say the network address, its associated subnet mask and gateway address are 172.16.0.0, 255.255.0.0, 172.16.0.1
If the VM was configured with IP address/subnet mask/gateway address: 172.16.0.10, 255.0.0.0 (wrong subnet mask), 172.16.0.1. With this configuration, this VM can ping to external networks such as 192.168.1.0/24 or 10.0.0.0/8.
Only drawback of this wrong configuration is that this VM could not connect to such networks as 172.16.1.0/16, 172.16.2.0/16 ...
Since all other networks cannot connect to the VM, the cause should NOT be wrong subnet.

The answer is A. This is a very poorly worded question. However, if one reads very carefully they can infer that a [different, but existing] VM **on the same subnet** was reachable. 
I believe this is simply a question which contains the answer even though it is somewhat ambiguous.....the new VM wasn't configured properly (Wrong Subnet - A) .
kind of a vague question but it definitely sounds like a gateway issue.
I agree, the answer is D because if the ping works from within the subnet, the ping test is failing to outside of the subnet because the gateway isnt letting you out

questions.question_text: A cloud implementation engineer successfully created a new VM. However, the engineer notices the new VM is not accessible from another network. A ping test works from another VM on the same subnet. Which of the following is the MOST likely problem?

A cloud engineer is deploying a new application to a multicloud platform. After running the script, the engineer sees the VMs were not created on one of the cloud providers. The engineer confirms the proper credentials are being used for all cloud providers and there is available capacity. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the deployment failure?

discussion.content: D. The script created to be deployed does not match the cloud provider API.

choices.D: The script created to be deployed does not match the cloud provider API.
choices.C: The additional cloud provider is in a separate time zone.
choices.B: The application does not have an adequate number of licenses.
choices.A: The cloud provider was not available.

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is deploying a memory-intensive, three-tier web application with a database back end to one server in an IaaS cloud platform. The minimum application memory requirements are as follows:
✑ RAM for Web Service Role: 1024MB
✑ RAM for Application Service Role: 2048MB
✑ RAM for Database Service Role: 4192MB
Configuration requirements state that web content should be separated from the operating system on another drive. Given this scenario, which of the following is the minimum amount of RAM required in GB and what is the most optimal logical volume design to BEST meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
this site has several wrong answers. 

the question already states the "minimum" so the answer is 7GB

C & E
Why 6GB? total of 7264 mb = 7.264 GB. Minimum 7GB.am i missing something?

choices.D: C:\Drive: OS, Web Service Role, Application Service Role, Database Service Role
choices.E: C:\Drive: OS G:\Drive: Web Service Role, Application Service Role, Database Service Role
choices.F: C:\ Drive: OS, Web Service Role G:\Drive: Application Service Role, Database Service Role

choices.B: The cloud provider offer and hybrid solution, in three regions with maximum RTT, is below 50ms, and the dropped packets are below 2%.
choices.A: The cloud provider is available in two regions, and it provides high SLA. The maximum RTT is below 50ms, and the dropped packets are below 2%.
choices.C: The cloud provider is available in three availability zones, the average RTT is below 50ms, and the dropped packets are below 2%.
choices.D: The cloud provider is available in two regions. The average RTT is below 50ms, and the dropped packets are below 2%.

discussion.content:
B is better than C.
"survive any regional disruption", 
B is in three regions, but C has nothing with regions.
Also "maximum RTT is below 50ms" is better than "average RTT is below 50ms".

questions.question_text: A real-time video-streaming company is determining the best cloud provider for high network performance, availability, and reliability requirements for the company's all-in cloud strategy. The new service should survive any regional disruption without any customer downtime. Which of the following is the BEST solution?
